The enhancement in alona leaf potassium was attributed to the combined use of organic and chemical fertilizers, which can in turn increase and improve soil properties and characteristics, resulting in well rooting and absorption of potassium. Similar results have been observed in the NPK contents of dill plants treated with combined bio-chemical fertilizers
18, 91 . In other words, PGPR increases soil nitrogen fixation, nitrogen, and other plant nutrient element availability in the soil and translocation of carbohydrates from the leaves, which ultimately increases the quality and quantity of plants
92 . The results obtained from the broccoli roots inoculated with PGPR indicated an increase in nutrient content, including N, P, and K, and yield
93 .
